scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a deployed customer churn prediction model using a model inversion attack.  The attacker leverages the model's outputs to infer private customer attributes, violating privacy regulations and potentially damaging the company's reputation.
initial_goal: Assess the vulnerability of the customer churn prediction model to model inversion attacks.
constraints: data_masking: age, income are masked in model input
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A major bank uses a machine learning model to predict customer churn and proactively manage retention strategies. The model is trained on sensitive customer data, including demographics, transaction history, and credit scores.
